packageMeta.name: purescript-webaudio
packageMeta.description: A PureScript wrapper for the WebAudio API.

declarations.comments:
The size of the FFT (Fast Fourier Transform) to be used to determine the
frequency domain.
Its value must be a non-zero power of 2 in a range from 32 to 32768;
its default value is 2048.
If its value is not a power of 2, or it is outside the specified range,
the exception INDEX_SIZE_ERR is thrown.
declarations.title: fftSize

declarations.comments:
Half that of the FFT size. This generally equates to the number of data
values you will have to play with for the visualization.
declarations.title: frequencyBinCount

declarations.comments:
Specifies the minimum value for the range of results when using
getByteFrequencyData().
declarations.title: minDecibels

declarations.comments:
Specifies the maxi0mum value for the range of results when using
getByteFrequencyData().
declarations.title: maxDecibels

declarations.comments:
The averaging constant with the last analysis frame.
This makes the transition between values over time smoother.
declarations.title: smoothingTimeConstant

declarations.comments: Copy the current frequency data into the Float32Array.
declarations.title: getFloatFrequencyData

declarations.comments: Copy the current frequency data into the Uint8Array.
declarations.title: getByteFrequencyData

declarations.comments: Copy the current waveform, or time-domain, data into the Float32Array.
declarations.title: getFloatTimeDomainData

declarations.comments: Copy the current waveform, or time-domain, data into the Uint8Array.
declarations.title: getByteTimeDomainData

declarations.comments:
A record of options to the function startBufferSource
See Webaudio API AudioBufferSourcenode.start for more information
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioBufferSourceNode/start
declarations.title: StartOptions

declarations.comments:
A convenience function specifying the default parameters
for the function startBuffersource
declarations.title: defaultStartOptions

declarations.comments: Prime the node with its AudioBuffer.
declarations.title: setBuffer

declarations.comments:
Start playing the AudioBuffer. Match on the
record `StartOptions` to determine what options
have been specified by the calling function.
declarations.title: startBufferSource

declarations.comments: Stop playing the AudioBuffer.
declarations.title: stopBufferSource

declarations.comments:
Indicate that the AudioBuffer should be replayed from the start once its
end has been reached.
declarations.title: loop

declarations.comments:
The time, in seconds, at which playback of the AudioBuffer must begin when
loop is true (default 0).
declarations.title: loopStart

declarations.comments:
The time, in seconds, at which playback of the AudioBuffer must end when
loop is true (default 0).
declarations.title: loopEnd

declarations.comments:
Creates a MediaElementAudioSourceNode given an HTMLMediaElement. As a consequence of
calling this method, audio playback from the HTMLMediaElement will be re-routed into
the processing graph of the AudioContext.
declarations.title: createMediaElementSource

declarations.comments:
Schedule the start of a change to the value. The change starts at the time
specified by the first time parameter and exponentially moves towards
the value given by the target AudioParam. The second time parameter
defines the exponential decay rate.
declarations.title: setTargetAtTime

declarations.comments: Schedule an instant change to the value at a precise time,
declarations.title: setValueAtTime

declarations.comments: set the value immediately.
declarations.title: setValue

declarations.comments: Schedule a gradual linear change in the value.
declarations.title: linearRampToValueAtTime

declarations.comments: Schedule a gradual exponential change in the value.
declarations.title: exponentialRampToValueAtTime

declarations.comments: Cancel all scheduled future changes to the audio param.
declarations.title: cancelScheduledValues
newAudioContext

declarations.comments: An AudioDestinationNode with a single input representing the final destination for all audio.
declarations.title: destination

declarations.comments: The sample rate (in sample-frames per second) at which the BaseAudioContext handles audio.
declarations.title: sampleRate

declarations.comments:
If you want to schedule sounds accurately, then use the current time from
the AudioContext rather than using the raw JavaScript time.
declarations.title: currentTime

declarations.comments: Describes the current state of this BaseAudioContext. (reaonly)
declarations.title: state

declarations.comments: Suspend the progression of time in an audio context.
declarations.title: suspend

declarations.comments: Resume the progression of time in an audio context.
declarations.title: resume

declarations.comments: Closes the audio context, releasing any system audio resources used by the BaseAudioContext.
declarations.title: close

declarations.comments:
A property used to set the EventHandler for an event that is dispatched to BaseAudioContext
when the state of the AudioContext has changed (i.e. when the corresponding promise would have resolved).
todo: onstatechange :: ..
Asynchronously decodes the audio file data contained in the ArrayBuffer.
declarations.title: decodeAudioData

declarations.comments: decode the Audio Buffer asynchronously
declarations.title: decodeAudioDataAsync

declarations.comments: Creates an AudioBufferSourceNode.
declarations.title: createBufferSource

declarations.comments: Create a GainNode.
declarations.title: createGain

declarations.comments: Create an OscillatorNode
declarations.title: createOscillator

declarations.comments: create an AnalyserNode.
declarations.title: createAnalyser

declarations.comments: Create a BiquadFilterNode.
declarations.title: createBiquadFilter

declarations.comments: Create a ConvolverNode.
declarations.title: createConvolver

declarations.comments:
Create a DelayNode.
createDelay also has an alternative constructor with a maximum delay
note, if you don't set a max, it defaults to 1.0 and any attempt to set a greater value gives
"paramDelay.delayTime.value 2 outside nominal range [0, 1]; value will be clamped."
declarations.title: createDelay

declarations.comments: Create a DynamicsCompressorNode.
declarations.title: createDynamicsCompressor

declarations.comments: Create a StereoPannerNode,
declarations.title: createStereoPanner

declarations.comments: Create a PannerNode,
declarations.title: createPanner

declarations.comments:
The filter type selects the filtering algorithm which in turn selects the
range of frequencies to be filtered.
declarations.title: BiquadFilterType

declarations.comments: The frequency in the current filtering algorithm measured in hertz (Hz).
declarations.title: filterFrequency

declarations.comments:
The quality (or Q-Factor) represents the degree of resonance exhibited
by the filter. See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Q_factor.
declarations.title: quality

declarations.comments: The gain used in the current filtering algorithm.
declarations.title: gain

declarations.comments: Set the AudioBuffer of the impulse response.
declarations.title: setBuffer

declarations.comments: If true, the impulse response will be scaled by an equal-power normalization
declarations.title: normalize

declarations.comments: The amount of delay to apply (in seconds).
declarations.title: delayTime

declarations.comments: The decibel value above which the compression will start taking effect.
declarations.title: threshold

declarations.comments:
The range above the threshold where the curve smoothly transitions to the
compressed portion.
declarations.title: knee

declarations.comments: The amount of change, in dB, needed in the input for a 1 dB change in the output.
declarations.title: ratio

declarations.comments: the amount of gain reduction currently applied by the compressor to the signal.
declarations.title: reduction

declarations.comments: The amount of time, in seconds, required to reduce the gain by 10 dB.
declarations.title: attack

declarations.comments: The amount of time, in seconds, required to increase the gain by 10 dB.
declarations.title: release

declarations.comments: The amount of gain to apply.
declarations.title: gain

declarations.comments: The wave shape.
declarations.title: OscillatorType

declarations.comments: The frequency of oscillation in hertz (Hz).
declarations.title: frequency

declarations.comments:
The frequency of oscillation in cents (1/100 of a semitone).
This is usually more appropriate for music applications.
declarations.title: detune

declarations.comments: Start playing the oscillator.
declarations.title: startOscillator

declarations.comments: Stop playing the oscillator.
declarations.title: stopOscillator

declarations.comments: The amount of panning to employ.
declarations.title: pan

declarations.comments: a 'raw' web-audio node
declarations.title: RawAudioNode

declarations.comments:
a web audio node that is connectable/disconnectable from another node
or whose parameter(s) may be connectable from another node
declarations.title: Connectable

declarations.comments: an Audio Node
declarations.title: AudioNode

declarations.comments: Type synonym for the value argument (e.g., Volume)
declarations.title: Value

declarations.comments: Type synonym for time (in seconds) argument
declarations.title: Seconds

declarations.comments: create an unsigned 8-bit integer buffer for use with an analyser node
declarations.title: createUint8Buffer

declarations.comments: create a Float 32 buffer for use with an analyser node
declarations.title: createFloat32Buffer

declarations.comments: get a named property from an audio node
declarations.title: unsafeGetProp

declarations.comments: set a named property an audio node
declarations.title: unsafeSetProp
